title: design and manufacturing project  OF Modulus of Elasticity
snippet:
You are required to do the following:
1.	Read ASTM D143 and decide the specimen dimensions for the typical ones shown in Figure 1.
2.	Reflect on the experience in Assignment 1 to determine the sample size (number of trials) in each sample (treat each student as a sample)
3.	Prepare a plan for the observations to be made (the readings, graph and other properties to be collected from the MTS machine.)
4.	Each student prepare his or her sample from the piece of timber given and conduct the experiment.
5.	Collect the individual data and collect the data from the entire group to assemble the population data.
6.	Carry out the statistical analysis and determine the Young’s modulus and the ultimate strength in compression
7.	Reflect on the process.



A Report structured in the following way:
i.	Introduction – Should answer the questions what, why and how (explaining the Aim). Then give a brief summary and explain ASTM D143 and describe the specimen dimensions. Then summarise the report structure.

ii.	Explain the experiment plan and how the data is collected from each trial from the sample.

iii.	Labelled graphs of the trials, the data for each student and a table showing the Young’s modulus and ultimate strength of each trial. THIS PART IS INDIVIDUAL

iv.	A table showing the Trial values and sample mean for the entire collection. It should include population mean and population standard deviation for the Young’s modulus and Ultimate strength. Plot the normal distribution graph for the two properties.

v.	Recommend safe values for Young’s Modulus and Ultimate Strength for use in designs giving your reasons. 

vi.	Learning Experience and Discussion 

vii.	Conclusions
